description: Size of second largest n-arc in PG(2,q), where q runs through the primes and prime powers >= 7.
comments: The Davydov et al. reference has data sufficient for a b-file. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Apr 18 2010
links: Alexander A. Davydov, Giorgio Faina, Stefano Marcugini, Fernanda Pambianco, New sizes of complete arcs in PG(2,q), arXiv:1004.2817 [math.CO], April 16, 2010. [_Jonathan Vos Post_, Apr 18 2010]
J. W. P. Hirschfeld, Complete arcs, Discr. Math., 174 (1997), 177-184.
J. W. P. Hirschfeld and L. Storme, The packing problem in statistics, coding theory and finite projective spaces, J. Statist. Plann. Inference 72 (1998), no. 1-2, 355-380.
G. Keri, Types of superregular matrices and the number of n-arcs and complete n-arcs in PG(r,q), Journal of Combinatorial Designs, Vol. 14 (2006), pp. 363-390.
example: m'(31)=22 because there are no complete n-arcs in PG(2,31) for 23<=n<=31.
author: J. W. P. Hirschfeld [ jwph(AT)sussex.ac.uk ]
extensions: Definition clarified by G. Keri (keri(AT)sztaki.hu), Jan 03 2008
